summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell for her access in her criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, for whom discovery materials are being transmitted to the detention center.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The Assistant U.S. Attorney who signed the letter transmitting discovery materials to the detention center for Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Strauss, as an Assistant U.S. Attorney, is part of the prosecution team transmitting discovery to the defendant, Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Transmission to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends discovery materials to the Metropolitan Detention Center for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell's access in her criminal case.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: This document is a formal cover letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office transmitting discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell while she was incarcerated.
It confirms Ghislaine Maxwell was an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn as of November 2020.
The document references the ongoing criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
Audrey Strauss, then the Acting U.S. Attorney for the SDNY, was directly involved in the prosecution's discovery process.
The document demonstrates standard legal procedure for providing discovery materials to a detained defendant.
